The Alhambra is an Andalusian palatine city located in Granada, in the autonomous community of Andalusia, Spain. The Holy Metropolitan Cathedral Church of the "Encarnación de Granada" is a Catholic temple in the Spanish city of Granada, home to the city's archdiocese. The Sacromonte Abbey, located to the northeast of the Spanish city of Granada, is well accessed by the Sacromonte road, which starts at the Weight of the flour located in the middle of the Cuesta del Chapiz, or on the way of San Antonio starting from Haza Grande. The Madrasa of Granada (in Arabic, مدرسة, \'school\', also called Yusufiyya, House of Science or Palace of the Madraza) was the first university that had Granada, in Spain. It was inaugurated in 1349 by the Nasrid king Yusuf I of Granada. [Citation needed] Currently this palace belongs to the University of Granada, dedicating almost the entire building to cultural activities. It is also the seat of the Royal Academy of Fine Arts of Our Lady of Sorrows.
Hotel Alhambra Palace is an emblematic luxury hotel and palace in the heart of the Alhambra in Granada. In the center of Granada, near the bullring and La Caleta, Antonio and Paqui run the La Taquilla restaurant, a cozy place where you will delight yourself with good wines and better tapas made with maximum product maximum quality products. The attention offered and a warm and friendly atmosphere embrace you to make you feel at home. El Rincón de Lorca - all the traditional flavor with touches of modern cuisine. In the historic center of the city of Granada. The best product elaborated and served in a cozy atmosphere full of history. Laseda Restaurant in Granada: The Laseda restaurant is located in the Plaza de Bib-Rambla (or Bibarrambla), also known for its popular.
The park Federico García Lorca is a public park in the city of Granada, Spain, built in tribute to the Granada poet Federico García Lorca. The Jardines del Triunfo in Granada was in the Arab period an extensive cemetery, founded in the s. XIII.
The cemetery was surrounded by a strong wall and defended at the entrance of each of the access roads to the town by doors with towers. Delimited by the roads Avda. De Andalucía, Calle Periodista Eugenio Selles and Calle Journalista José Mezcua Ruiz extends this beautiful park. Located on the Carretera de Motril, at the height of Calle Recorder David Roberts, its total area is 4151 m 2.
The Mulhacén, with an altitude of 3,478.6 meters above sea level, is the highest peak in the Iberian Peninsula and the second in Spain behind the Teide, 3,718 meters above sea level. The Mulhacén is part of the Sierra Nevada National Park. The Peak of Veleta is, with an altitude of 3395.68 meters above sea level, the fourth highest summit in Spain and second of its mountain range, only behind the Teide, Mulhacén and Aneto. The Trevenque peak is a mountain located on the northwest face of the Sierra Nevada, between the municipalities of Dílar and Monachil. The Trevenque has a height of 2,079 meters. The top of this dolomitic peak is accessible on foot by two routes. The Alcazaba is, with 3,371 meters, the sixth highest summit in Spain, behind the Teide, Mulhacén, Pico de Aneto, Veleta Peak and Pico Posets.
